children.description: Handles user input for location fields, fetches autocomplete suggestions from Google Maps API, and updates application state.
Renders the location suggestions in a dropdown list and handles the selection of a suggestion.
A utility function to delay the execution of a function until after a certain time has passed without it being called.
Toggles the visibility of the side navigation menu by adding or removing the 'visible' class.
Asynchronously retrieves the user's current geographic location and reverse-geocodes it to an address.
Toggles the visibility of the map container, updates local storage, and invalidates the map size to ensure correct rendering.
Checks the browser's geolocation permission status and updates the UI accordingly.
Updates the UI elements related to location permission based on the current permission state ('granted', 'prompt', or 'denied').
Uses the Geolocation API to get the user's current position and updates the start location in the application state.
Initializes the application by setting up saved state, checking permissions, and adding all necessary event listeners.
Checks if the browser supports notifications and displays a permission banner if permission has not yet been granted or denied.
Requests permission from the user to send desktop notifications.
Displays a persistent desktop notification about the current or next stop in the route.
Toggles the visibility of the floating AI chat container.
Shows or hides a notification badge on the AI assistant tab button based on the application state.
Adds a new message to the AI chat interface, distinguishing between user and assistant messages.
Sends the user's message to the AI, displays it in the chat, and processes the AI's response.
Opens the modal dialog for AI assistant settings.
Closes the modal dialog for AI assistant settings.
Saves the provided training data to local storage for use in future AI prompts.
A wrapper function to make an asynchronous call to the `websim.chat.completions.create` API with a given prompt.
Generates a prompt for the AI to provide van loading advice based on the current calculated route.
Generates a prompt for the AI to provide important reminders based on stop notes and route context.
Generates a prompt for the AI to provide detailed information about the next stop on the route.
Generates a prompt for the AI to provide placement advice for a scanned parcel based on the current route.
A helper function that compiles current route information into a structured object for AI prompts.
Opens the note editing modal for a specific stop or the start location.
Closes the note editing modal.
Saves the content of the note modal to the appropriate stop in the application state and updates the UI.
Initiates the browser's location permission prompt by calling the `getCurrentLocation` function.
Saves the current application state (stops, location, options) to the browser's local storage.
Loads the application state from local storage on startup, restoring the previous session.
Uses the Google Maps Geocoding API to search for addresses within a given UK postcode.
Renders the list of addresses found from a postcode search and handles their selection.

Adds a selected delivery location to the list of stops, using the user's potentially refined address text from the input field and validated coordinates. Duplicate checks are now based on coordinates to ensure unique locations are added.
Removes a specific delivery stop from the list based on its index.
Toggles the 'completed' status of a delivery stop and updates the UI.
Renders the list of delivery stops in the 'Stops List' tab based on the current application state.
Optimizes the order of delivery stops using various algorithms like nearest-neighbor, simple distance sort, or clustering.
Applies the 2-opt heuristic to a given route to further refine it and find a shorter path, often used for fuel-saving optimization.
A route optimization strategy that groups stops into local clusters, sorts the clusters, and then optimizes the path within each cluster.
Calculates the great-circle distance between two geographic coordinates using the Haversine formula.
The main function for route calculation; it orchestrates getting the current location, optimizing stops, and updating the UI and map.
Renders the ordered list of stops in the 'Live Route' tab, including navigation and completion buttons.
Calculates the total distance of a route by summing the distances between consecutive points.
Removes all route-related elements from the UI, such as route lines on the map and the route summary.
Clears and redraws all markers on the map for the start location and all delivery stops, reflecting their current status.
Draws a polyline on the map connecting all the points of a calculated route and fits the map view to the route's bounds.
Handles the logic for switching between different content tabs in the main sidebar area.
A utility function to find and set the index of the first incomplete stop as the current stop.
A helper function that calls multiple UI update functions to ensure the entire interface is synchronized with the state.
Enables or disables the 'View Live Route' button based on whether a route has been calculated.
Enables or disables the 'Calculate Route' button based on whether any delivery stops have been added.
Resets the entire application state and UI to its initial, empty state.
Filters the visible stops in the live route summary based on a search query.
Populates the start and end stop constraint dropdown menus with the current list of delivery stops.
Initializes and displays the postcode scanner modal, requesting camera access and starting the video stream.
Stops the postcode scanning process, releases the camera stream, and hides the scanner modal.
Starts an interval timer to periodically call the `scanFrameForPostcode` function.
Captures a frame from the video stream, sends it to an AI service for analysis, and handles the extracted postcode result.
Dynamically loads the Google Maps JavaScript SDK script tag into the document.
A callback function that initializes the Google Maps services (Autocomplete, Places, Geocoder) after the SDK has loaded.
Updates the visual status indicator for the Google Maps API key to show whether it is 'Saved' or 'Not set'.
Saves the entered Google Maps API key to the application state and local storage.
